name: IntentQL
tagline: Machine-readable contracts for AI agent interactions
what: IntentQL is an open specification that allows websites to declare their capabilities and constraints in a machine-readable format. AI agents read the contract and know what they can and cannot do.
why: AI agents currently interact with websites by scraping HTML and guessing at structure. This breaks when sites redesign. IntentQL provides stable, declared interfaces that survive UI changes.
how: Websites publish an /agent.json file declaring intents, endpoints, and constraints
Agents fetch and read the contract before interacting
Agents call only declared endpoints with declared parameters
Constraints explicitly state what is not supported
key_insight: Contracts don't enforce compliance â€” they filter for it. Agents that read contracts respect constraints. Agents that don't reveal themselves as incapable.

tested.constraint_compliance: 100% of agents that fetched the contract
